summary: The DC Criminal Reforms to Immediately Make Everyone Safe Act (DC CRIMES Act) primarily focuses on juvenile crime in the District of Columbia. It aims to limit youth offender status to those 18 and under, mandates the establishment of a publicly accessible website by the Attorney General containing juvenile crime statistics (including arrests, demographics, court outcomes), and restricts the District of Columbia Council from altering existing criminal liability sentences. The bill intends to increase public safety and transparency in juvenile justice.
